Game.Name: Tagin' Dragon (USA) (Unl)
Game.plot: Overview:Tagin' Dragon (originally released in Asia as Colorful Dragon) is an arcade action game with a focus on competitive multilayer developed for the Nintendo Entertainment System by Sachen and published by Bunch Games in 1990. It is essentially a game of tag set within twenty unique mazes where players control European dragons and must defeat other players by "tagging" them from behind for a set number of times depending on the length of their tail. The game also supports three types of play: single-play, competitive one-on-one and competitive free-for-all.
Game.Notes: 20 challenging levels! Play tag with maze after maze full of dragons. Only a dragon's tail is vulnerable, so sneak up from behind and munch till they turn to bones! If you are fast enough to snatch the magic lantern, you can discover the secrets buried within the walls of each maze.
